message.body: Looks like we're paired again. But yeah there's a small bar upstairs at KFN then two open rooms towards the front of the building
Hey, phone died at work and I tried to switch numbers to my Google Voice number but it didn't continue the convo. Are we still connected?
Yep, we are
Nice. Yeah, I've never been to the KFN upstairs, but it seems like they're doing that more often these days than before.
Yeah, I think phonographic arts philly booking crew organizes most of the shows up there
Nice. Don't know them, but I just might look into it. I just went to Underground Arts for the first time and that place is a pretty solid venue. Been there?
Oh hell yeah. A friend used to barback there. Who'd you see? Think I've been there 3 times now
I was actually playing, but seeing as we're supposed to withhold personal info over the platform, I'm just going to say that you might able to guess which band I'm in.
Got you. I saw Hot Snakes & Pissed Jeans once, then PJ again for their record release
Fantomas out of the number one position for me.
Nice, I played with Pissed Jeans a while ago and they tear it up. They were one of my fave live bands to see. Still, tho, I think that no one has pushed
Number 1 position?
Awesome. And yeah, their frontman rules haha
As favorite live band that I've seen.
Yeah, I got to see Faith No More when they reunited a few years ago, which was really really awesome to see.
Oh okay, for some reason I got that text in 2 parts and it wasn't in order
I was about to say, that last text was pretty long and could've gotten rearranged. The platform does that sometimes.
Alright, good to know
What's fantomas like?
It's another Mike Patton project (singer of Faith No More and Mr. Bungle) that is kinda heavy metal mixed with ambience and avant garde.
When you said they've got a great front man, I originally thought you meant Patton (hence the FNM shoutout), and realized that you meant PJ.
